Title: Protesters demand South Africa sever ties with Israel over Gaza
Summary: More than 3,000 people marched through Cape Town on Saturday, calling for South Africa to cut trade and diplomatic ties with Israel . Pretoria has been a leading critic of Israel’s actions over the war in Gaza .

Title: MANI raises alarm over rising suicide cases
Summary: Mentally Aware Nigeria Initiative (MANI) calls for urgent media responsibility and public awareness . Nigeria loses an estimated 15,000 lives to suicide every year .

Title: How Ododo restored suspended medical programmes at Kogi varsity – VC
Summary: The Vice Chancellor of Prince Abubakar Audu University, Anyigba, has attributed the restoration of the university's suspended medical programmes to the political will and financial support of the institution’s Visitor, Governor Ahmed Usman Ododo . Prof. Marietu Ohunene said the restored medical programmes at the university

Title: Northern Senators pay tribute to late Senator Solomon Ewuga
Summary: The Northern Senators Forum (NSF) has announced with deep sorrow the passing of Senator Solomon Sunday Akku Ewuga, who died on September 23, 2025, at the age of 70 . Senator Ewugai was hailed as a towering figure in Nigerian politics .

Title: Amorim under pressure as Brentford stun Man Utd
Summary: Manchester United crashed to a 3-1 defeat at Brentford on Saturday . Bruno Fernandes's penalty miss piled pressure on beleaguered boss Ruben Amorim .

Title: Edo govt plans to immortalise late Arase
Summary: Edo govt plans to immortalise late Inspector General of Police, Solomon Arase, who is an indigene of the state . The governor stated this when he received the body of the late Arase .

Title: Under-fire Amorim accepts criticism as Man Utd crash at Brentford
Summary: Lacklustre United's third loss in six Premier League games this season has left Amorim fighting to avoid the sack . United lost 3-2 at home to Brentford on Saturday, their third defeat in six games .

Title: PDP National Convention: Committee announces indefinite deadline for submission of forms
Summary: National Convention Organising Committee (NCOC) of the PDP has extended indefinitely the submission of expression of interest and nomination forms for aspirants . The party in a statement by the Secretary, Publicity Sub-Committee, Debo Ologunagba, on in Abuja, said that the deadline had been extended from the

Title: Photos: Jonathan, Osinbajo, Mark, others grace Amaechi’s son’s wedding in Abuja
Summary: Rotimi Amaechi's eldest son, Dr. Chikampa, wed his heartthrob, Anita Nwabueze, in Abuja, on Saturday . Ex-Rivers State Governor, Rotimi Amaechi, gathered to celebrate the wedding solemnization of his eldest son .

Title: IPOB faults Federal High Court ruling on Nnamdi Kanu
Summary: Indigenous People of Biafra disagreed with Justice James Omotisho’s ruling that its leader, Mazi Nnamdi Kanu, must explain certain things on his terrorism charge . IPOB questioned Justice Omotosho on what he wants Kanu to explain .
